particleLexeme: 1. Used at the beginning of a sentence or immediately next to a verb to mean the action takes place at the time of talking, writing or signing and not some other time. English = now, at present, presently, currently, at the moment.
2. Used at the beginning of a sentence to mean the action takes place or the situation exists at this time in history. English = nowadays.
verbLexeme: 1. To be people or things that exist now, rather than those that existed in the past or those that may exist in the future. English = (be) present, (be) current.

2. Used immediately next to a sign which names a period of time ('morning', 'afternoon', 'night', 'year' etc.) to mean one of those periods of time which is happening now or closest to you. English = 'this morning', etc.
nominalLexeme: 1. The present time of talking, writing or signing and not some other time. English = present.
2. [With stress, squint and/or grimace] the very instant at which you are signing, right now at the time of signing.
